string type int2str >>

char

Converts to a character array.

Syntax

res = char(var)
res = char(var1, var2)
res = char(var1, var2, ..., varN)

Input argument

var

a cell of strings, or an numeric array.

var1, var2, ..., varN

strings or an numeric arrays.

Output argument

res

a string

Description

char converts numerical input into character data by taking the corresponding unicode character for each element.

Examples

M = [ 104   101   108   108   111;
20320   22909 32    32    32];
char(M)


R = char('these', 'are', 'test', 'strings')

See also

double.

History

Version Description
1.0.0 initial version

Author

Allan CORNET
